Articles.Content:
I have a problem where I have no control anymore of my craft. Meaning that using the arrow keys or SAS preprogrammed directions the craft does not change direction. Now I know you all think that this is a gameplay thing where you can lose control if certain conditions are not met. Of course this is also the kind of threads you find when googling this problem.

HOWEVER, THIS IS NOT THAT KIND OF PROBLEM.

As far as i can tell right now it's a real bug. The most noticable proof of this is that the craft does want to move! you see it moving very slightly in the direction it is supposed to go. In other words THE REACTION WHEELS ARE WORKING! It is like two reaction wheels that would move in opposite direction asserting equal force on the craft in different directions. So you see a slight response but the overal influence is null. This problem however occured at a random time. Not directly after a stage switch. Not during ascent. Everything was fine and nothing changed of the craft but suddenly I could not move anymore.

Switching to another craft dit not work. Switching to map view and back did not work, Reloading KSP did not work. Controling another craft works just fine. Moving the point of control does not have any influence. Energy is available abundant and available in the reaction wheels itself. Control is 100%. (even a pilot that is unnessasary is present). The yaw and roll indicators on the bottom left also work as intended. Trust works as intended, I can accelerate and decelerate.

Below a picture of my craft.

As of now I do not know if I can reproduce the issue. But i would like to know if anyone has the same issue and if any fix is present. I am using a modded version but i don't believe this has any influence. (Mechjeb, tweakscale,Alarm,etc). More information will follow if other recognise the problem. Otherwise I will assume this is not a real problem and i will attempt to relaunch my craft. (this was slightly chalenging)

pic: https://postimg.org/image/had1vidsf/

https://postimg.org/image/5kioeaf0z/

 

https://postimg.org/image/5kioeaf0z/  and https://postimg.org/image/c3gc8spz7/  for console output with mechjeb disabled and most nonessential mods removed (like planetshine, alarm etc.)

 

Ok after a long time debugging with some superb guys from the IRC chat, I confirmed that tweakscale was the problem. I still do not have a perfect fix but now I know it is not a generic ksp bug. Thread can be closed if noone has similar problems.

Edited November 24, 2016 by Yonaf

IIRC some of Mechjeb's autopilot modes disable the input controls. Anything left activated?

Tweakscale was the problem. During a burn something would go wrong, this is replicable. Due to scaled components around eachother the components would become stuck in space. Meaning that these components would not move or could be moved by impact from other parts.
